task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 262°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the building to estimate it, so I will tilt my view upwards to see the roofline.
I have seen the top of the building, and now I need to look down to see the base to get a complete view for my height estimation.

Having viewed both the top and bottom of the building, I can now estimate its height by counting the floors; it appears to be about 7 stories tall, and assuming a standard height of 3.5 meters per story, I estimate the total height to be around 24.5 meters.
